description: The 'Pima Indians Diabetes' dataset aims to predict the likelihood of diabetes based on various diagnostic measurements. It contains records from female patients of Pima Indian heritage, aged 21 or older. The dataset includes 768 instances with 8 numerical features such as number of pregnancies, plasma glucose concentration, blood pressure, skin fold thickness, serum insulin, body mass index (BMI), diabetes pedigree function, and age. The target variable, 'Outcome', is binary (0 for non-diabetic, 1 for diabetic).
task: Predict whether a patient has diabetes based on medical diagnostic attributes.

features.Glucose: Plasma glucose concentration 2 hours after an oral glucose tolerance test (continuous, ratio)
features.BMI: Body mass index (weight in kg / height in m^2) (continuous, ratio)
features.DiabetesPedigreeFunction: A measure of diabetes in the family history (continuous, ratio)
features.Age: Age of the patient in years (continuous, ratio)
features.Outcome: Indicating whether the patient is diabetic (1) or not diabetic (0) (categorical, nominal)

Outlier Management: Added 23 outliers to the Age column
Added 23 outliers to the Glucose column, from both sides
